rComments: Sandy's syntax class is probably the hardest thing you'll ever do. You essentially write grammar rules for English from scratch based on data sets she gives you. There is an essay due every class. Expect to spend an ungodly amount of time on it every day, and you better be prepared to manage your stress.

Very intense and demanding class but insanely rewarding at the end if you stick with it. Sandy is an amazing teacher with a clear passion for what she does and her little giggles are the best. My favorite thing about Sandy is her very thorough and carefully written feedback on the assignments that she grades. Definitely recommend taking her class!
She's a tough grader. If you have the option to not take her class, DO IT. She can be really moody and won't say hi to students outside of class

Brutal. Assignments due every class and they require LOTS of intense problem solving and extremely detailed writing. Don't slack or you won't pass!!! Material is introduced on hw and left for you to figure out with little to no support. Syn 1 is required for ling, but the way Sandy structured this class actually turned me off the linguistics major.
Sandy is amazing, and although you have a lot of hw in her class, she knows what she is talking about and is always willing to help.

I LOVE SANDY. She's intense, just like this class. And although you may want to kill yourself for most of the assignments, Sandy knows exactly what she's doing. She is a tough teacher, but really one of the best. I MISS HER

Sandra is an excellent teacher. You will view language very differently after you have struggled through the daily HW. Her classes are always informative, and she answers all questions. Your class will derive everything themselves, meaning that the HW is tailored to your class. This leads to interesting developments(such as how "it" is dealt with).

People who gave her bad reviews probably didn't go to lectures. It's doable IF you attend them; she teaches based on class, NOT on the text. She is clear and helpful. Do the homework, attend lectures/sections, study, (like EVERY other class) and you'll pass. She's great but gets a bad rap because logic isn't as easy as gen ed lower-div classes

Sandy is great. I don't especially like syntax, but she conducts the class as if students were researchers,and we have to figure out what is English syntax from scratche. However, this a very, very demanding class, with 3 homeworks a week, and believe me you need to spend hours on them before figuring a way out.

I hated Chung as a teacher. She is very self-centered and when you ask her questions, she doesn't understand why you are asking her because her teaching is "perfect". She made me really hate the subject. Its very math heavy. If you are good at math, you will be fine. The tests are very difficult so be sure to study. Not an easy A.
The best teacher for logic, but still not exactly great. If you need to take Phil 9 for your major than take it with her and not Otte. If you just want to take the class for fun or for a GE...DONT!

This class is difficult. Attendace to lectures and sections are mandatory since Sandy doesnt take the assigned book seriously. She gives off attitude in class if you ask her a question over material she thinks she explained clearly. Go to TA's for help. Do not reccomend class with her.
Sandy Chung is amazing: she is without a doubt the most brilliant professor I have ever had. She can rationalize an answer to any theoretical problem that you can present her with.

The class is easy as long as you go to lecture and section. But lecture is hard to attend because Chung is so frustrating. The TAs seemed to know the material better than her. And for some reason she assigns a textbook, but tells you to ignore most of what it says and do things her way.

I wish someone would have told me how hard this class was.  I was always stressed that i was gonna fail the endless mid-terms.  When I asked for help she had a "well what don't you get" kind of attitude.  Dont take this class.
Cool prof. Easy to understand. Hard grader.

I took logic with Sandy and barely passed. The subject alone should be hard enough to teach and Sandy didn't make it easier.  Tests were way harder than the hw and my TA was very remeniscent to Bobby Hill....one of the TAs was basically homeless (philosophy major).... don't take this class!

Sections are mandatory. Students need to go to class since Sandy does not go completely by the book. Four midterms in which students get to drop their lowest score. Final worth 15%. Logic is so dumb. Do not take this just for the IH - take a Soc class instead!
No Comments

The most like Yoda of all UCSC professors.  Sandy is a genius.  You can see this by the way she goes into a trance when you ask her a difficult question.  She will sit there for up to a minute as if mesmerized by the wood grains on the table.  The result -- when she comes to -- is a brilliant mini-essay on the topic at hand.  Highly recommended.

I'm not going to lie: Sandra is a HARD teacher. This is because she makes you think, and she truly offers a different way of thinking, and for most people, a completely new perspective on language. While her assignments may make you pull your hair out, after I passed this class I was very proud of myself as well as sure that I had learned something

AMAZING != easy. Sandy's a brilliant syntactician. She demands that her students think for themselves.  I'm proud to have taken Syntax I, Syntax II and Structure of Romance Languages from Sandy Chung. She takes a special interest in students who show their

I've been at SC for a year and I'd have to say that Sandy is the best teacher I've had. The syllabus wasn't easy but she definitely made everything clear and it was easy to get a good grade if you payed attention and did the work.

VERY condescending. Seems to play favorites. Introduces new concepts on HW, not prior to. Grades consistantly lower than her TAs. NO supplementary materials (no book, only classnotes) aside from a few sparse handouts. You'll spend a lot of time scribbling down datasets. While the subject matter is interesting, the class is a recipe for disaster.
If you majored in obfuscation, this class (taught by Sandra Chung) would be perfect!

Inadequate teaching. Mulitple homeworks for which she does a poor job of providing support. Homeworks are due before the topic is introduced in class, making one rely upon nothing when considering possible correct soultions. Having no supplementary materials (textbooks, readers, etc) to rely on forces attendance. Lecture is slow, expectations high.

Sandy was VERY clear in her explainations and once you ask a  question, she always does an excellent job with answering it as clearly and efficiently as possible.She has a rather strict teaching style though, and is very harsh if she grades your assignments, though. I reccomend her for Syntax I.

While it is true she repeats herself often, many students in the class need it. I'm taking her class in logic, and its very good. The material on quantifiers and predicate logic was tripping up a lot of students, and so she has been going slowly. 2 thumbs up

Chung had a tendency to repeat the lesson, with little actually being taught.  completely inaccesible, and a haughty manner (did you learn that at harvard as well, ms. chung?), I would not recommend her as a teacher.
